Legal Practice Management Software

Cybersecurity for Law Firms

Thank you for attending Clio's webinar.

For Arizona Lawyers:

Please download this Certificate of Attendance for use when filing your annual affidavit of meeting your MCLE requirements.

This webinar should be eligible for up to 1.0 hours of CLE credit in Arizona.

Arizona Certificate of Attendance

For California Lawyers:

As an attendee of this webinar you are eligible for 1.0 General MCLE Credit in California. Please download and complete the attached Certificate of Attendance.

California Certificate of Attendance

You must keep this certificate for at least one year from the date you report your MCLE compliance online.

Please complete this evaluation survey that California requires we submit after each MCLE activity.

https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/CA_MCLE_Cybersecurity

For Other States

We are happy to support your applications for CLE in your jurisdiction via reciprocity with California, where we are an accredited CLE provider. Please use your followup message as proof of your attendance to the event, as it is only being sent to confirmed attendees.

You will need to submit the following information to your CLE authority for reciprocity credit:

  • proof of attendance from the course sponsor (this message, which is only sent to attendees);
  • proof of accreditation by an approved jurisdictions (our listing as an MCLE approved provider in California);
  • proof that written course materials were made available (the slides and handouts linked for download in this email); and
  • proof that the faculty included at least one attorney in good standing (faculty bios in the slides).

This material should be sufficient for you to obtain CLE credit in your jurisdiction.

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact us directly at support@goclio.com.
